intro: Hapalorchis bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a distinct morphology with two prominent lobes or horns on its thallus, giving it its common name. It plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the biodiversity of forest floors. Hapalorchis bicornis is often used in ecological studies to assess environmental conditions and habitat quality.
